intro: Bolbitis longiflagellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed water fern, is a member of the Marsileaceae family. It is a submerged aquatic plant characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves that float on the water's surface. The plant typically grows in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that develop underwater. Bolbitis longiflagellata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms and contributing to water filtration.
